HistoryOfPresentIllnessText:
Stark, Sanza, NP - 03/26/2020 1:00 PM EDTFormatting of this note might be different from the original.
CASTLE BLACK TELEHEALTH FOLLOW-UP NOTE

Visit Date: 03/26/2020
History obtained from: informant: Patient


CC: Cellulitis of left pinky fnger

HPI:
John Snow is a 25 year old male with has Reflex sympathetic dystrophy of upper extremity - follows w/ Dr.Davy 718-287-1000; Essential hypertension; Asthma; Morbid obesity (HCC); Cervical myelopathy (HCC); Displacement of cervical intervertebral disc without myelopathy; Neck pain; S/P laminectomy; Obstructive sleep apnea; Anemia; Anxiety; Prediabetes; Persistent depressive disorder with anxious distress, currently moderate; Exacerbation of asthma; Encounter for immunization; and Type 2 diabetes mellitus with complication, without long-term current use of insulin (HCC) on their problem list.

John Snow is being seeing today for a follow up. Last week he was diagnosed and treated for cellulitis of left pinky finger. Patient is currently on day 10/10 of Keflex. He reports her swelling, redness, and pain have resolved. The discoloration around her cuticle is also gone, per patient. is almost resolved. John had one episode of fever early during abx course which he says has not repeated.

Tamika K Day denies dizziness, blurred version, fever/chills, chest pain, palpitations, difficulty breathing, flu-like symptoms, abdominal pain, n/v/d, dysuria, hematuria, melena.

Assessment/Plan:
1. Cellulitis of finger of left hand
- Day 10/10 of abx course; resolved
- Take last dose of Cephalexin (KEFLEX) 500 MG orally this evening
- No need to cont. abx ointment

2. COPD/ ASTHMA
- Stable
- Cont. Albuterol/atrovent nebs Q4-6 hrs PRN
- Continue Advair
- Cont. Singulair
- Cont. Claritin to avoid allergy-related exacerbations
- Avoid triggers
- Pulm consult still pending since 9/2019; patient reminded and encouraged to f/u
